meanings.definition: The state or quality of being extremely cold or icy.
meanings.sent1: The gelidnesses of the snow-covered mountains took my breath away.
meanings.sent2: I could feel the gelidnesses of the frozen lake through my thick gloves.
meanings.sent3: Despite the gelidnesses outside, the children still wanted to build a snowman.
meanings.sent4: The gelidnesses of her stare made me shiver with unease.
meanings.sent5: The gelidnesses of the ice palace was like stepping into a fairy tale.

meanings.definition: The act of becoming frozen or chilled.
meanings.sent1: The gelidnesses of the water turned it into solid ice overnight.
meanings.sent2: After being caught in the storm, I could feel the gelidnesses creeping into my bones.
meanings.sent3: The gelidnesses of the freezer made the ice cream too hard to scoop.
meanings.sent4: As the gelidnesses of winter set in, the trees stood still and silent.
meanings.sent5: The gelidnesses of the cold room made it difficult to stay inside for long.
